_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
HARVEST LAND COOPERATIVES
HIGHWAY 14 EAST
SPRINGFIELD, MN.56087

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION:JOEL HEILING,PLANT MANAGER

Risk Management Plan EXCUTIVE SUMMARY
1.  The Harvest Land Policy

The owners,management, and employees of Harvest Land Cooperatives are committed to the prevention of any
accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur,  the facility is prepared to wrok
with the local fire company,  or other authorities,  to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to the
people and the enviroment.

2.  Facility Information
-The primary activity at Harvest Land is the storage and blending of fertilizers for sale to farmers.
-Anhydrous Ammonia is received,  stored and distributeded for direct application for crop production nutrients.
The maximum quantity stored would be 334,000 pounds which would include two storage tanks.  26,000 and 30,000
gallons,  plus rolling stock filled to 85% of volume available.  The maximum quantity handled at any one time would be
the same as the maximum quantity stored, 334,000 pounds.

3.  The Accidental Release Prevention Program
Harvest Land has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous
Ammonia, K-61.1" published by the American National Stanards Institute, Inc.,  and the Standards of th U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) 29 CRF 19*10.111.  "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia".

4.  The five year accident History.

A.  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facilitiy, not to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.
